meanings.definition: To pluck or remove with tweezers.
meanings.sent1: She tweezed the splinter out of her finger.
meanings.sent2: I tweezed the stray hair from my eyebrow.
meanings.sent3: He tweezed the tiny bug from the flower carefully.
meanings.sent4: The gardener tweezed the weeds from the garden with precision.
meanings.sent5: The chef tweezed the herbs delicately for garnish.

meanings.definition: To pinch or squeeze with tweezers.
meanings.sent1: The tailor tweezed the fabric to check its quality.
meanings.sent2: She tweezed the cloth to test its durability.
meanings.sent3: He tweezed the paper to see if it was thick enough.
meanings.sent4: The jeweler tweezed the metal to shape the delicate design.
meanings.sent5: The artist tweezed the clay to create intricate patterns.
